# Mean of a dataset

This is normal text
...and here's some code:

```{r}
print("Hello")
```


```{r simulation, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
set.seed(1)
x <- rnorm(1000)
my_dat <- data.frame(x)

hist <- ggplot(my_dat, aes(x))
hist + geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.1)
mean(x)
```

Variable from one to the other?

```{r yay, echo=FALSE}
head(my_dat)
quality <- 6.29
```

And finally, the quality of this dataset is `r quality`%

Some more simulated data:

```{r simulateddata, echo=TRUE}
x <- rnorm(100); y <- x + rnorm(100, sd=0.5)
```

Here's a scatterplot.
```{r scatterplot, fig.height=4}
par(mar = c(4,4,1,1), las = 1)
plot(x, y, main = "My Simulated Data")

```

## Tables

```{r}
library(datasets)
data(airquality)
fit <- lm(Ozone ~ Wind + Temp + Solar.R, data = airquality)
```

Here's a table of regression coefficients.
```{r showtable, results="asis"}
library(xtable)
xt <- xtable(summary(fit))
print(xt, type="html")
```
